ProjectTitle: Using far-red light to steer carbon assimilation and translocation in tomato
InitialFeedbackHistory:
23/05/2024
3. Documentation and Metadata
Please describe in the second question the metadata that will be created. 
It can be as simple as metadata automatically generated from instruments (parameters, ect),
the information about an experiment in a spreadsheet, 
or the metadata associated with Word and Excel files (right mouse click on a file --> properties - check tab "details" for things like author and creation date). 
If you have any questions on this, don't hesitate to contact us at onderzoek2bergen@kuleuven.be
5. Data Preservation after the end of the Research Project
"Where will these data be archived (stored and curated for the long-term)?"
On which of the Universityâ€™s central service will you store the digital data long term?
Note that both OneDrive and the Personal network drive (I-drive) are personal storage solutions that disappear if you leave KU Leuven at some point, and thus not considered suitable for long term storage (10 years). 
6. Data Sharing and Reuse
"Will the data (or part of the data) be made available for reuse after/during the project?"
Can you specify how you plan to publish the data?
Note that publishing data often refers to data publications in data journals, or to data published in repositories. 
Publishing results is not considered publishing data. 
As you have no restrictions on sharing, you can consider publishing your data in a repository like RDR. This also ensures the long term preservation of your data after the end of your project.
